data.description:
A watchface based off of the upcoming video game "YIIK: A Postmodern RPG" by Ackk Studios. The watchface shows one of the main characters of the game, Alex.

Current features:
- Time display (12 & 24 hour modes supported)
- Date display
- Weather and temperature
- Battery meter HP bar
- Bluetooth connection status (with vibration alerts)

Future features:
- Motion activated calendar and weather forecast
- Selectable characters
- And hopefully more!

**I am in no way affiliated with Ackk Studios nor do I claim ownership of any of the images used in this watchface.

latest_release.release_notes:
- Added local weather and temperature (updates every half hour)
- Slight cosmetic changes

data.description: Pinwheel is a colorful watch face that changes every minute.  Day of the month is in the center circle, which is red if Bluetooth is lost.  Battery level on a bottom graph shows red when 20% or less, and blue when charging. White dots indicate 10% battery levels.

changelog.release_notes: Future proof for Pebble and Pebble Time when they upgrade to newer phone app.
Added support for Pebble and Pebble Steel. Added support for Simplified Chinese and Traditional Chinese.
Added color themes, selectable in phone settings.
Improved font for date using custom font.
Added support for French/français, German/Deutsche, and Spanish/Español.
Added splash screen. Improved memory management.

Added support for Pebble Time Round.
Fixed comma after month to display descender.

1. Removed leading zero ("0") in 12-hour format for 1:00AM through 9:59AM.
2. Increased font size for AM/PM in 12-hour format for readability.

Dual timezone watchface. Top is local time. Bottom is universal time (UTC).
Very useful for pilots and Amateur Radio (ham) operators.

Initial release. Only supports Pebble Time, which supports timezones.

data.description:
Dual timezone watchface. Top is local time. Bottom is universal time (UTC). Very useful for pilots, amateur radio (ham) operators, and astronomers. Color theme is selectable in watch face Settings. Language is selectable in Pebble Settings.

English - Français - Deutsch - Español - 简体中文 - 繁體中文

data.description:
HANNA clock for Pebble and Pebble Steel.
한나 한글 시계! 네 귀퉁이에 점으로 매분을 표현!

2.0 버전 새기능
- 설정 기능 추가
- 매시간 알람 기능 추가
- 배경/시간표시 폰트 변경 가능

1.3 버전 새기능
- 화면 갱신 로직 변경 (아마도 이전보다 빠르게 갱신됨!)
- 네귀퉁이에 점으로 +1분 ~ +4분 표현 (5분 단위 분침처럼 생각하시면 됩니다)
  + 1시방향 +1분
  + 5시방향 +2분
  + 7시방향 +3분
  + 11시 방향 +4분
New in 2.0
- Configurable App!
- Custom hourly vibration!
- On/Off font swap mode! (use solid font for background[off] font)
New in 1.3
- Improve display logic (may be faster than before)
- You can check every minute (clockwise dot indicator) 
   +No dot : +0 min
   +Dot at upper right : +1 min
   +Dot at bottom right : +2 min
   +Dot at bottom left : +3 min
   +Dot at upper left : +4 min

Nestedly Inspired by soomtong
(http://github.com/soomtong/HannaClock)
who inspired by Toby Yun.(http://tobyyun.com/wooclock/)

The font used in here was published in a public.(http://www.woowahan.com)

latest_release.release_notes: compile using SDK 3.0

data.description:
Watchface designed for the new Pebble Time Steel!
Minimalistic, clear, modern and stylish but nevertheless easy to read and with important informations: actual week number, date (ddmmyy) and battery percentage.
animated charging indicator and 12h/24h mode supported.

Settings:
- color of minutes
- vibrate at Bluetooth loss
- set Date to US Style (mmddyy)
- show seconds instead of week number

To save battery it only updates every second when plugged in or show seconds is selected.

data.author: Rainbows Puppies & Sunshine

changelog.release_notes: Version 1, 9/2/2015

data.description:
Analog face with hour numbers randomly assigned a font and position along the chapter ring.

At 3:00, the hour hand will point to the 3 (wherever on the clock face that may be) and the minute hand will point to the 12 (wherever that may be). On a regular clock face, the hands would always form a right triangle at 3:00, but on the RandAlog Face, there's no telling what angle will form because the 3 and the 12 will be randomly positioned.

The odds of this face ever appearing like a regular clock face is 1 in 47,9001,600; or about once every 911 years.

latest_release.release_notes: Version 1, 9/2/2015

data.title: RandALog Plus

data.author: Kenny L.

changelog.release_notes: Hopefully this fixes all the crashing issues I had.  This will probably be the last update the this face with Pebble announcing that they will no longer be supporting new features and updates to their watches.  That is unless I see more crashes!  I will fix those!
Fixed error in calculating countdown time for automatic updates
Hopefully fixed the crashing issue

BIG 4.0 for 4.0!
Diorite support - BAM
Weather support - BAM
Automatic updates - DOUBLE BAM
Cleaner Code - BAM^2
Good luck, have fun, email me with problems!
Added peek support.  It's ready for Doirite, but cloudpebble struggles to compile the code.  Release soon.

bug fixes
-random problems
-timer not working correct across months because of leap years (whoops)
-something else I'm sure

Turned off test purchases (one of these days I'll learn)
Bug fixes
Forgot to change the influence auto animations had on quiet time.

Fixed: 
UNLV color correction 
Animations might not have happened if delay was not selected. 

Hopefully fixed: 
Quite time not turning off in the morning

Fixed a problem where setting the countdown's gametime to AM was reading it as PM always.
Also fixed a problem where selecting the countdown to always display not working correctly.
And finally fixed the animation problem, should be real smooth now!
Fixed it so if you choose paid options that the team is not set to SC unless you have chosen random.

Well, looks like I had purchases in test mode.

Sorry for the email spams.  But some people might have gotten it for free, so congrats!
Somehow forgot to include the setting to select Michigan State.  Sorry Sparty!  Please email me if you feel like your team is missing.  There are so many that it is very easy to overlook one team.

Somehow forgot to include the animation delay setting. It's back in there. Though, not sure about other people, but the animation doesn't ever quite go all the way. This is highest on my priority list of fixing!
Fixed kiezelpay canceling purchase right after requesting the purchase.

Changed the premium check location.

If selecting premium features, the face will reset all your settings automatically (just in case you don't end up purchasing the full watchface).  If you buy the product and re-submit your setting, then it should no longer reset anything. I'm working towards a more convenient way around this.

Added a lot of new stuff!
That being said, I've implemented KiezelPay. The face without any bells and whistles is available for free, but if you want the countdown feature, health data, or random team support you will have to pay $1. Future updates might be included in this $1, so buy now to make sure you have the most feature rich face! 
New watch support! Now supports Original and Round Pebbles! And it's ready for Pebble 2, and I'm working on Pebble Time 2. 
Clay support: Change your watchface settings without needing an internet connection! 
Health data added. See how many steps you've taken, and try and score a TD by meeting your weekly average. 
ToDo List: Weather (and gameday weather maybe)

Changed Illinois logo
Added Custom Countdown Timer
Added option for delay when showing timer on animation (so if you want the time in a dark place you don't have to wait)
Added random team to beat

Added Team Meteor.
Fixed logo for Ohio State.
Added random favorite team that updates every Sunday
Added countdown to gameday.  Currently it is set to only be able to countdown to 12:00 Eastern Time (or the first game on Saturday)

Set the foundations for random team to beat and custom time for countdown to gametime.  Coming soon.
Fixed blemish on UVA and K State choices

data.author: Sam Jerichow

changelog.release_notes: Xone runs now on the Pebble Time Round!

data.description:
Summary: 45° numbers placed in an X
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

The idea was to connect the four time telling numbers to form a single shape. The connection occurs through the corners of the numbers which have been rotated by 45. The resulting shape resembles one X, hence the name Xone. It's not always a single contiuous shape but the exceptions add up to the interesting appearance of this watchface. The numbers are read usuallly top-left, top-right, bottom-left and bottom-right with some head tilting needed maybe and keeping the overlap in mind, that creates a slight crypticness. 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2015 Sam Jerichow

latest_release.release_notes: Xone runs now on the Pebble Time Round!

data.author: Turner Vink

changelog.release_notes:
Added:
- Hurrá! Hungarian is now supported

Fixed:
- Weather now updates hourly on the minute you launched Square; this should stop the API key from getting locked out for too many requests per minute

Fixed:
- Weather info not appearing due to locked OpenWeatherMap account
- Settings saving every time weather is updated

Changed:
- Weather now updates hourly instead of every half hour (this shouldn't make a difference in accuracy as OpenWeatherMap only updates data every two hours for the free plan)

Added:
- Hourly vibration option
- Option to hide leading zero in 12 hour time

Added:
- Urrà! Italian language support

Added:
- Shake to show weather is back!

Changed:
- Bluetooth disconnected indicator shows up regardless of weather mode

Changed:
- Toggle to enable or disable Health is always visible without having to set the middle bar to step goal first
- Settings are saved after they are received on the watch in order to keep data if the watchface isn't closed before switching to a new one

Version 5.0! Another rebuild bringing some new features and optimizing old ones.

New:
- Support for Pebble 2
- Offline configuration with Clay
- Seconds
- Step tracking using the middle bar
- Night mode
- Manual weather location
- Error display for when weather can't be fetched

Changed:
- Bluetooth status is now shown in place of the weather when disconnected
- Weather is just one larger size now

Removed:
- Shake to show weather

If you have any feedback please get in touch through the Pebble App Store!
- Fixed Bluetooth vibration settings not persisting between loads

- Added an option for a larger weather font
(This version was previously released, but introduced an error on Aplite regarding app mesages. This issue has been resolved. Sorry for any inconvenience!)

- Bluetooth vibration settings are now saved when the watchface closes
- Weather should now update on the hour properly

- Added language support for French, Spanish, and German
- Adjusted the position of the weather on Pebble Time Round
- More detailed forcasts

- Support for Pebble Time Round! (If you have any feedback please email me!)
- Option to use a weekday/date/month format instead of weekday/month/date

- New battery bar style! It now shrinks from both ends instead of just one
- Option for static middle bar if always seeing battery level isn't your thing

- Increased font size for the date
- Added a Bluetooth status indicator with optional vibrations

- Fixed weather not fetching. OpenWeatherMap recently started required an API key, which Square was not using
- Weather doesn't update if it's turned off in settings
- Fixed config page URL
- Added option to hide weather all the time
- Switched to openweathermap.org for weather data

- Added background colour option Pebble Time and Pebble Time Steel
- Fixed charging status on Pebble and Pebble Steel

data.description:
Square is a clean looking watchface packed with tons of features!
If you enjoy it, leave a heart and consider donating through the link on the settings page!

- Offline configuration with Clay
- Supports English, French, Spanish, German, Italian, and Hungarian
- Choose any colour for the text and background
- Pick different colors during the night
- Weather information using either GPS or manual location
- See weather all the time, when you flick your wrist, or hide it completely
- Middle bar can be static, show battery level, or progress to your step goal
- Bluetooth dis/connect vibrations and status
- Hourly vibration
- Two date formats, THU APR 2 or THU 2 APR

latest_release.release_notes:
Added:
- Hurrá! Hungarian is now supported

changelog.release_notes:
- Fancy new config page
- Menu icon!

Vacation Time has been rebuilt from the ground up!
- New config page using Slate
- Fun launch animation
- Supports English, French, Spanish, and German
- Much cleaner code

- Added hourly weather forecast (currently English only)
- Added ability to hide weather forecast
- Battery bar and weather show on shake/tap
- Added battery status bar (with pretty colours!)
- Added colour support for Pebble Time and Pebble Time Steel

- Changed 'del atardecer' to 'del ocaso' to allow for increased font size
- Increased font size

- Changed font sizes to allow for translated strings
- Localization! Vacation Time now supports:
    - English
    - French
    - Spanish
    - German
(I only speak English and the French I've learned in school. If anything is incorrect please let me know! Some accents are not available due to the font.)

data.description:
For when the hours don't matter!

See the progress through the day in 8 easy to read stages with colour-matched backgrounds. Shake to view remaining battery, current "feels-like" temperature, and hourly forecast.

Stages:
midnight (12AM to 2AM)
early morning (3AM to 5AM)
morning (6AM to 8AM)
late morning (9AM to 11AM)
afternoon (12PM to 2PM)
late afternoon (3PM to 5PM)
evening (6PM to 8PM)
night (9PM to 11PM)

latest_release.release_notes:
- Fancy new config page
- Menu icon!

data.title: Vacation Time

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Adds support for Pebble firmware V4, Pebble 2 and Quick Views.

data.description:
Homage to Back to the Future.

Flux capacitor tells the time - hours top left, minute top right and AM/PM at the bottom. 

Date as per display in the car, with the Pebble battery level added.  

The battery level is color-coded and the date color changes to match.
    > 50%     - green
    30 - 50% - amber
    < 30%     - red

Screenshots show:  
(1) 04:25AM - October 21 2015 - battery 100%
(2) 07:31AM - August 31 2015 - battery 40%
(3) 12:49PM - September 05 2015 - battery 20%
(4) 09:18PM (With Quick View)

Thanks to:
- Sam Jerichow for help with this design & particularly the background image
- Gehden Agena who prompted me to do this watchface - hope you like it!


Watchface Design & Programming Copyright © 2015 Nev Rawlins

latest_release.release_notes: Adds support for Pebble firmware V4, Pebble 2 and Quick Views.

data.description:
Inspired by the bar chart, I created this watchface. It is very colorful on Pebble Time. 

It includes five different bar chart mode at this moment, i.e., Horizontal, Horizontal Inverted, Vertical, Vertical Inverted and Polar. In the coming updates, I will add rainbow, diagonal and cross bars options.

Hope you all enjoy it.

Garnet from "Steven Universe" shows you the future time with Future Vision!  That's right, this watchface will show you what time it will be one hour from now... and one time zone to the west.  Which just happens to be the current time.

The position of the "sparkle" on the top of her shades is a battery meter (all the way right = 100%, left = 0%).

data.author: iRon

changelog.release_notes:
Changed code to be compatible with SDK 3.0 and added two features:
* Support for Basalt (color)
* Automatic power save:
By default the round in the top is blinking every second. This appears to consume a considerable amount of battery power and doesn't add much functionally to the clock itself but just simulates the original Berliner Uhr.
In this version, the Berliner Uhr goes in power save after being idle for 30 seconds. In power save, the round will only blink every 30 seconds (Off: first 30 seconds of a minute. On: the last 30 seconds of the minute). When the Pebble is tapped, the full simulation will start again and the round will blink every second.
Minor cosmetic changes

data.description: The Mengenlehreuhr (German for "Set Theory Clock") or Berlin-Uhr ("Berlin Clock") is the first public clock in the world that tells the time by means of illuminated, coloured fields, for which it entered the Guinness Book of Records upon its installation in 17 June 1975. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mengenlehreuhr

latest_release.release_notes:
Changed code to be compatible with SDK 3.0 and added two features:
* Support for Basalt (color)
* Automatic power save:
By default the round in the top is blinking every second. This appears to consume a considerable amount of battery power and doesn't add much functionally to the clock itself but just simulates the original Berliner Uhr.
In this version, the Berliner Uhr goes in power save after being idle for 30 seconds. In power save, the round will only blink every 30 seconds (Off: first 30 seconds of a minute. On: the last 30 seconds of the minute). When the Pebble is tapped, the full simulation will start again and the round will blink every second.

data.title: Berliner Uhr

data.author: Charles Tatum II
data.description: A touch of television nostalgia! From a time in which stations signed off every night and replaced regular programming with a black and white test pattern and a musical tone, Test Pattern is inspired by an image seen long before overnight infomercials. Displays the hour, minute, second, month, date and day of the week. "Sign off" your watch every night with Test Pattern! Works on both Pebble (monochrome) and Pebble Time (color) devices.
data.title: Test Pattern

data.description:
QUARTER

+ Watchface formed by a QUARTER of: Minimalism, Stylish, Original, Useful

+ Background color squares means QUARTERs of Hour:
- 0(Empty): o'clock
- 1: fifteen
- 2: thirty
- 3: forty five
- 4(Full): hour ending

Fast reading of time with 7 minutes error maximum, which usually is irrelevant. 
But if you want to see the exact time, use the "Show minutes" style choice. 
Also you can disable quarters and set the full background color.

+ Two QUARTER style: screen quarter or frame quarter

+ The screen is divided in four QUARTERs to show the information.

+ Two QUARTERs of the first hour digit is taken by Date or Minutes.

latest_release.release_notes: 2.2 settings page host changed

data.title: Quarter

data.author: Starthief
data.description: A slightly unusual watchface.  The number of horizontal pink lines represent hours; vertical green lines in the top half are tens of minutes, and in the bottom half are single minutes.  Lines are clustered/spaced to make them easy to recognize at a glance instead of tediously counting them.  The example given is 5:51.

data.author: Rainbows Puppies & Sunshine

changelog.release_notes: Version 1, 8/28/2015, RandALog with roman numerals

data.description: Analog face with Roman Numerals that are randomly assigned a position along the chapter ring. At 3:00, the hour hand will point to the 3 (wherever on the clock face that may be) and the minute hand will point to the 12 (wherever that may be). On a regular clock face, the hands would always form a right triangle at 3:00, but on the RandAlog Face, there's no telling what angle will form because the 3 and the 12 will be randomly positioned. The odds of this face ever appearing like a regular clock face is 1 in 47,9001,600; or about once every 911 years.

latest_release.release_notes: Version 1, 8/28/2015, RandALog with roman numerals

data.title: RandALog Roman

Enjoy your always on watch display with this colorful watch face. Every minute flowers will animate, bounce, rotate and change color to show a different combination each time you look at your watch.
* Flowers become orange then red when battery is low.
* Special super fast drawing routine for very smooth animation while preserving battery.
* And because the animation is cool, you can start it with a flick of your wrist!

* 시계의 설정에 따라 12시간/24시간 표시

data.description:
제가 필요해서 만든 간단한 워치 페이스입니다.
날짜, 요일, 배터리 정보, 블루투스 연결정보를 표시합니다.

시간 : 시계의 설정에 따라 12H/24H
요일 : 한글 언어팩을 설치하셔야 한글로 나오고 아니면 네모박스로 나옴. (시간대가 Asia/Seoul 이어야 한글이 나옴)
날씨 : 안나옴
블루투스 : 연결 시 파란색, 끊어지면 빨간색 (상태 변하면 진동 두번.)

* English description
Simple watch face for me. :)
It can display date, time, battery level, bluetooth state.

12H/24H suport : according to the setting of the clock
bluetooth state : blue icon(connected), red icon(disconnected)
weather : not supported.

data.title: Pattern Time

data.author: Steven Blair

changelog.release_notes: Added option to change estimated walking time to stations.
Fixed bug with backlight.
Significant update to watchface UI and some new capabilities for finding trains.
Fixed bug relating to train times after midnight.
Added new mode for showing trains only on "taps" (shaking the watch). Added indication if the last network request failed.
Updated logic for GPS-based location: the destination is chosen by time rather than by assuming the home station.

Added experimental option to alert if the watch's (or the phone's) time differs from UTC by more than 30 s. If the second or third upcoming trains have been cancelled, "canc." is shown rather than the ETA in minutes, as well as being coloured red.
Fixed minor bug.
Added cancellation warning (red text) for 2nd and 3rd trains.
Added battery-low indicator - a circle in the upper left corner.
Fixed an issue with day and time schedules.
Updated for latest platform update.
Added option to use HTTPS.
Minor improvement to text centring for single-digit dates.
Re-upload of pbw file

Added ability to customise days and times when train data gets fetched.

Increased normal update period to 15 minutes.
Minor fixes for periodic updates.
Fixed issues relating to cancelled or delayed services.
Initial display of cancelled services.
Added option for disabling using location for finding closest railway station.

data.description:
A Pebble watchface for UK rail commuters.

Displays the next three trains for your daily commute to and from work. It is designed to require minimal effort to show important information that a rail commuter needs on a daily basis.

You can specify your normal home and work railway stations using the configuration page. Only direct rail services, and routes with one change, are supported.

Rail service data are obtained in real-time using the Huxley web service, which accesses National Rail Enquiries data. In GPS mode, the watchface requests your current location from your phone and determines the closest railway station. If you are near your configured home station, you will be shown routes to your work station; otherwise you will be shown routes home. This means that even if you happen to travel away from your normal work station, you may still be presented with a reasonable rail service to get home.

Alternatively, if location is disabled or unavailable, your journeys are still planned using the time of day and your predefined stations.

Updates are requested periodically, but can be requested at any time by "tapping" (shaking) the watch. When the next train is due to arrive or is slightly late, updates are triggered more frequently. Train times are only fetched during likely commuting times (but this can be customised).

Where specified in the data, the estimated time of departure (ETD) is displayed. Otherwise, the scheduled time of departure (STD) is shown.

The watchface also shows the time and date in a clear and sensible way for UK users.

latest_release.release_notes: Added option to change estimated walking time to stations.

data.title: Commuter Bliss UK

data.author: Tristan Schorn

data.description:
The mighty dragon guards its wealth.

This is a remake of an old watchface by Bit Hangar. Original artwork and code by Bit Hangar, updated code and artwork by Tristan Schorn and Mitchel Matthews.

Updates to come, including a blinking animation, and alternative colour themes!

latest_release.release_notes:
-Added a simple wooden background texture to the clock face
-thickened up minute and hour hands to increase legibility

data.title: Dragon Clock Reborn

data.author: n4ru
data.description:
A simplistic Hearthstone watchface.

Stars indicate battery status:
5 stars > 90%
4 stars > 70%
3 stars > 50%
2 stars > 30%
1 star > 10%

Add me on Hearthstone - Thirk#1334 !
data.title: Hearthstone Legend

data.author: AngerDanger

changelog.release_notes: Fixed a potential graphical glitch on Pebble Time.
Added ability to invert colors by flicking wrist, and on the Pebble Time, digit colors are customizable.
Added ability to toggle between displaying the date in mm/dd and dd/mm formats.
Added ability to view date on wrist flick and turn this feature off as well.
Works with original Pebble and fixes potential flickering when multiple digits need to flip.
*crosses fingers*

data.description:
Every minute, the digits that have changed will flip to reveal the new time. A flick of the wrist displays the date, the digit color is customizable, and a wrist flick within two seconds of launching the app inverts the background.

If you like this watchface, stand in front of a mirror, close your eyes, and try to see yourself through your own eyelids. Or return to this app, scroll through all the watchfaces until you find mine, and hit the heart button. Both seem equally likely.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed a potential graphical glitch on Pebble Time.

data.title: Flip Tile

data.author: Steven Schmatz

changelog.release_notes: Version 1.0! Works on Aplite and Basalt.

data.description:
Segments is a simple watchface that counts the day down in 6 minute blocks.

There are 240 of these blocks in a day – an easily number to comprehend. Better than 86,400 seconds in a day, and more specific than 24 hours.

By better being able to mentally grasp how much time your actions take, you'll understand time better and be able to spend your time more effectively.

latest_release.release_notes: Version 1.0! Works on Aplite and Basalt.

data.title: Segments

data.description:
Based on the original MGS Codec.
- Bars light up to indicate watch battery level
- BTC or PTT text at top indicates BlueTooth Connection
- Day of week displays at bottom
- ">" icon shows up when charging

data.author: HW

changelog.release_notes:
개인적인 목적으로 만들었지만, 혹시나 필요한 분 있을까 싶어서 올립니다. 
- 배터리, 날씨, 요일 확인 가능한 시인성 좋은 시계 
- 기상청의 동네예보 표출 동네예보는 시계를 흔들면 나왔다 사라집니다. 
동네예보는 GPS 위치를 기준으로 갱신합니다.(시간, 온도, 상태, 강수확률 을 표출합니다) 
즉, 한국이 아니면 이 워치페이스는 사용 못합니다. 
동네예보는 초기 부팅시, 매시 0분/30분 업데이트 됩니다.
korea only

data.description:
A watchface based on the German highway ("Autobahn") signs.

It displays the current location and temperature as well as the month and day.

NEW: It displays your distance to Berlin (Alexanderplatz) in km!

Things to come soon: 
- choose between Fahrenheit/Celsius
- choose fixed location for weather and distance separately
- display custom texts

latest_release.release_notes:
- new background
- day will be printed correctly as 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th and so on
- NEW: shows the distance to Berlin (Alexanderplatz)

data.title: Autobahn
